attributes.action: Do not allow the taxpayers to fund a £46 million Queen Elizabeth statue.
attributes.additional_details: The UK government has set out a provisional £23-46 million to spend on a statue of the late monarch. Considering that the Sovereign Grant already reaches nearly £100 million, and that the Windsors’ private estate collects tens of millions more from the taxpayer in the form of rented out space to the NHS and schools, I do not believe it right for us to fund more of their projects.
attributes.background: I would like the Government to remove the current budget for a statue of Queen Elizabeth. The Windsor family can then pay for the statue themselves, and the £23-46 million should be spent investing in the NHS.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Limit the public budget for memorials to former Monarchs.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/709520
